newsitem.title: BRAZIL: CVRD auction reset for May 5 - ministry.
newsitem.headline: CVRD auction reset for May 5 - ministry.

text.p: The Brazilian government has rescheduled the privatization auction of state miner Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (CVRD) for May 5, a spokeswoman for the Planning Ministry said.
The Planning Ministry has ordered the National Development Bank (BNDES) to publish on Saturday a special notice in the Official Gazette and Brazil's local main newspapers with the new date, she said.

If the auction cannot take place on Monday, the government will reschedule the auction again for the following day and will keep resetting it every day during a certain period of time that may be 10 days, she added.

The government's decision to reschedule the auction for Monday came after a judge at the Superior Court of Justice (STJ) said he would not rule before Monday on a government request that all injunctions impeding the CVRD sale be heard by a single court.
"I will examine the process on Saturday and Sunday and on Monday I may have a decision," Justice Democrito Reinaldo told reporters on Thursday.
A STJ decision in the government's favor would allow the government to move to overturn injunctions that had been granted by several different courts.
The CVRD auction was originally scheduled for Tuesday, but the selloff, the biggest in Latin America to date, has been delayed by a slew of legal challenges.
